title: Senior Software Engineer - Partners Platform (SSP 0321)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by continuously improving the eCommerce experience in Greece. We are shifting our focus from the discovery phase as a price comparison platform, to the last mile delivery supporting both our consumers and partners at any stage of their journey to success.
We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

We are looking for experienced Senior Software Engineers with a strong technical background to scale our systems, improve the performance and reliability of our existing products and build the next-generation services that will expand the Skroutz ecosystem.

Team

The Partners Platform group at Skroutz is committed to offering trouble-free and seamless eCommerce experience to 8500 (and counting) merchants with over 5 Million products to grow their online or offline business.
We are organized in small, talented and fully fledged teams. Backend and Frontend Engineers, Tech Leads, Designers and Product Managers work closely together to tackle hard problems efficiently and build a strong merchant value proposition with new features and services.

  • Our main product Skroutz Merchants is a collection of tools, dashboards and services that help merchants in their day-to-day workflow to unlock the full potential of Skroutz platform.
  • We have built our own Skroutz Analytics platform that aggregates eCommerce data from Skroutz partners’/shops’ websites and provides meaningful time series insights to merchants.
  • We have developed our own efficient billing systems to meet our commercial needs, based on redirection traffic analysis (Cost Per Click) and order attribution (Cost Per Sale).
  • Last but not least we provide a set of internal tools and automated processes alongside a well-integrated CRM to our beloved Commercial team helping them to support merchants at any stage of their journey to success.

Examples of work you might undertake

  • Improve order management in Skroutz Merchants to streamline merchants’ workflow.
  • Introduce new features and products to Skroutz users in order to boost merchant value proposition.
  • Work on our Analytics platform which handles over 30 Million requests per day and its adjacent services.
  • Boost our Marketplace service offerings to further expand our eCommerce solution for brick-and-mortar shops.
  • Develop and maintain our in-house affiliate management system.
  • Enhance our billing algorithms, develop monitoring tools and build fraud detection mechanisms.
  • Improve our Merchants' support operations with new services and automated processes.
requirements:
What skills and experience you will need

  • At least (5) years of working experience as a Software Engineer in a professional setting.
  • Excellent knowledge of database systems (relational, document-based, etc).
  • Solid algorithmic and software engineering background.
  • Solid understanding of web architecture.
  • Intrigued by the product as much as by the technology.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication skills and team spirit.

We will appreciate if you have

  • Good knowledge of Ruby/Ruby on Rails is a huge plus, but we believe that languages and frameworks can be learned; we care much more about your general engineering skills.
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks/UI libraries.
  • Familiarity with OOP principles and design patterns.
  • Comfort with TDD and other testing practices.
  • Exposure to architectural patterns and the production system of a large, performance-intensive web application.
  • Contributed to open-source projects.

title: Frontend Developer - Skroutz Last Mile (FD 0321)
description:
Skroutz Last Mile is “running” fast.

Our vision is to revolutionize the eCommerce Last Mile experience in Greece and become a prominent reason for the end to end consumer experience through Skroutz. Our mission is to manage and distribute Skroutz Marketplace orders.

We provide the necessary technical tools in order to manage the fleet and deliver the orders to all Skroutz users quickly and efficiently.

What we are looking for

We are looking for a Frontend Engineer with a strong technical background and a “get-things-done” attitude who is eager to learn and apply new exciting technologies. You will be part of a small, talented and motivated team, tackle hard problems and have freedom to innovate and provide novel solutions.

Technologies we use

Our main stack is Ruby for the backend - using the Ruby on Rails framework - with Javascript (ES6) and VueJS for the frontend. Our main storage is a Postgres database. Our everyday goal is to pick the best tool possible in order to deliver optimal results!

Examples of your daily tasks

  • Build tools used by other members of the team or clients
  • Identify inefficiencies on the software used by the team and provide better solutions
  • Build efficient interfaces for managing complex operational problems
  • Collaborate with experienced engineers
requirements:
Your Skills & Experience

Experience

  • At least (3) years of working experience as a Frontend Engineer in a professional setting
  • Very good knowledge of JavaScript
  • Experience with VueJS
  • Experience with HTTP protocol and APIs
  • Knowledge of current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance optimization, accessibility, and usability
  • Good understanding of UX design principles and methodologies

Skills

  • Intrigued by the product as much as by the technology
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Easy going attitude, good communication skills, and team spirit

We would appreciate if you have

  • Familiarity with the latest JavaScript features (ES6+)
  • Familiarity with Vuex
  • Familiarity with CSS and Sass
  • Comfort in TDD and other testing practices
  • Worked with a version control system (preferably Git)
  • An eye for detail and a sense of design
  • Shareable open source contributions or personal projects will help us in the evaluation process
